item.title: Rensselaer at Work Host Mechanical Engineering Review on September 18
item.description: Date: Thursday, September 18, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work faculty on a 30-minute information session covering Rensselaer’s online, project-based Master of Engineering program in Mechanical Engineering. Experienced engineers are asked to take on larger and more complex tasks as they progress in their careers, and this program provides the necessary breadth and depth, no matter where one’s career takes them. Please RSVP to attend

item.title: ID Cards Required to Access Meal Plans in Dining Hall
item.description: We hope your semester is off to a great start! Please be reminded that starting immediately, all students with an active meal plan must present their valid student ID card to access meals in the dining halls. This policy helps ensure efficient service and accurate meal tracking.

item.title: 2025-26 Student Advisory Council (SAC) - Application deadline September 24
item.description: Wednesday, September 24, 2025 8:00 AM - 7:00 PM - Applications are now open for the 2025–26 Student Advisory Council (SAC)! Hosted by Vice Provosts Dr. Rob Hradsky and Dr. Matt Oehlschlaeger, the SAC connects students with campus leadership to shape academics, student life, and RPI culture. Meetings are biweekly on Fridays, 12–1:30 PM. Apply by Sept. 24 to make your voice heard and create positive change. Questions? Contact Quadir “Q” Webster at webstq@rpi.edu.

item.title: Students, Faculty and Staff with Windows 10 on personal computers not managed by RPI
item.description: Microsoft Windows 10 support ends on October 14th, 2025. This means that as of this date, Windows 10 systems will cease to be eligible for support including important security patches. Without appropriate mitigation, Windows 10 systems and your data will be at significant risk. Additionally, they will be non-compliant with multiple RPI security policies and may be denied access to the campus network to reduce risk and maintain a secure cybersecurity posture. Click in for recommendations.

item.title: EARN YOUR Mercer X Skills Badges
item.description: The Mercer XLab is now offering a chance to earn limited edition Fall 2025 Skills Badges! To improve your Mercer X Skill Set there are three levels to obtain: Level 1 is your learning, Level 2 is applying your learning to a project, and Level 3, the gold standard, is teaching someone else! We offer the opportunity to earn PCB Pro (printing PCB prototypes), PCB Designer, Hot Worker (soldering), Spice-EE (Spice simulation), Instrument Wiz, and IC Designer skills. Earn yours before they run out!

item.title: DotCIO announces Retirement of EZ-Snapshot Service
item.description: This notice is to announce the retirement of the EZ-Snapshot service effective Monday, November 3rd, 2025. Sometimes referred to as EZ-Backup, the service was created in 2006 using enterprise-class tape backup technology and was used to backup departmental, research and individual servers and workstations. It has fallen out of use in the past several years, having been replaced by a modern disk-based backup solution.
